title: Function Concepts-Tabular and Analytical: Rational, Part A

content.question: Part A (i) The function <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is defined by <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals open parentheses g circle f close parentheses open parentheses x close parentheses equals g open parentheses f open parentheses x close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo>∘</mo><mi>f</mi></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>. Find the value of <math alttext="h open parentheses 6 close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mn>6</mn></mfenced></math> as a decimal approximation, or indicate that it is not defined. (ii) Find the value of <math alttext="f inverse open parentheses 4 close parentheses"><msup><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mn>4</mn></mfenced></math>, or indicate that it is not defined.

frqParts.text: Part A (i) The function <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is defined by <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals open parentheses g circle f close parentheses open parentheses x close parentheses equals g open parentheses f open parentheses x close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo>∘</mo><mi>f</mi></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>. Find the value of <math alttext="h open parentheses 6 close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mn>6</mn></mfenced></math> as a decimal approximation, or indicate that it is not defined. (ii) Find the value of <math alttext="f inverse open parentheses 4 close parentheses"><msup><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mn>4</mn></mfenced></math>, or indicate that it is not defined.

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
